[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.1 Purpose: The Cask System (CS) defines requirements for managing dataset types, instances, and operations across apps.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.2 Scope: CS supports dataset creation, sharing, versioning, and schema configuration.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.4 Product Functions: CS facilitates dataset versioning, sharing, and reconfiguration.

[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.1 System Interfaces: CS integrates with CLI, REST, and pipelines.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.3 Hardware Interfaces: CS operates on scalable cloud and on-premises servers.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.4 Software Interfaces: CS supports APIs for dataset operations and migrations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.6 Memory Constraints: CS handles large datasets and schema updates.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.7 Operations: CS is designed for continuous availability and compatibility checks.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.8 Site Adaptation Requir: CS supports multi-region and dataset-specific configurations.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.9 Interfaces with Servic: CS links to app artifacts and external schema repositories.
[SUBSEC] 1.3 Product Perspective.[SUBSUBSEC] 1.3.2 MISSING-TAG2: CS provides web and CLI tools for dataset management.

[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.5 User Characteristics: CS serves developers, data scientists, and admins.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.6 Limitations: CS relies on compatible schema definitions and network availability.
[SEC] 1. Introduction.[SUBSEC] 1.7 MISSING-TAG1: CS requires adherence to deployment standards.

[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-001: The system shall integrate with CLI and REST for dataset management.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-002: The system shall provide APIs for pipeline and app integration.
[SUBSEC] 2.1 External Interfaces.REQ-INTF-003: The system shall allow secure dataset schema sharing across apps (REQ-DSGN-002).

[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-001: The system shall provide clear error messages for version conflicts.
[SUBSEC] 2.3 Usability Requirements.REQ-USAB-002: The system shall provide an intuitive UI for schema validation and dataset tracking.

[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-001: The system shall enable dataset creation with schema configuration.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-002: The system shall support versioning and compatibility checks for dataset types.
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-003: The system shall allow reconfiguration of dataset properties (REQ-ATTR-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-004: The system shall enforce schema validation during pipeline creation (REQ-DB-002, REQ-DSGN-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.2 Functions.REQ-FUNC-005: The system shall track dataset sharing and usage across apps.

[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-001: The system shall process dataset updates within 5 seconds for datasets up to 100MB (REQ-DB-001).
[SUBSEC] 2.4 Performance Requirements.REQ-PERF-002: The system shall support up to 2,000 concurrent users.

[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-001: The system shall store dataset metadata with version history and allow rollback to previous versions.
[SUBSEC] 2.5 Logical Database Requiremen.REQ-DB-002: The system shall manage schema configurations and logs.

[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-001: The system shall comply with migration standards.
[SUBSEC] 2.6 Design Constraints.REQ-DSGN-002: The system shall encrypt all communications.

[SUBSEC] 2.8 Software System Attributes.REQ-ATTR-001: The system shall enforce atomic operations.

[SUBSEC] 2.7 MISSING-TAG3.REQ-COMP-001: The system shall adhere to ISO standards for data integrity.

[SEC] 3. Verification: Schema validation, version checks, and performance benchmarks.
[SEC] 4. Supporting Information: Schemas, versioning rules, and API documentation.
[SEC] 5. References: ISO standards, CLI, and REST APIs.
